column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: This year, we started The Good Work Design Project to create a mentally healthy IAG by designing work that prevents harm, promotes wellbeing and supports productivity. Our people's psychosocial health was a focus before COVID-19 and became more critical following the pandemic.
column21: Good Work Design Project, Mental Health, Pandemic

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column7: Workers must observe and cooperate with the IAG Safety and Wellbeing Framework and all policies (including this Policy), procedures, rules, directions, instructions, etc. People Leaders must, as reasonably practicable, also Proactively identify any risks and hazards that might impact the physical or psychological safety and well-being of people in IAG Workplaces.

Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: We also launched our first careers week, Brilliant Me: Activate Your Brilliance, hosting over 80 events that attracted 10,000 registrations to participate.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In November 2021, we launched two multi-year immersive programs, partnering with industry and leadership experts to build and broaden capabilities and skills across our circa 370 senior leaders. Early measures show positive shifts in mindset and behaviour.
column21: Immersive Programs, Leadership Experts, Capability Building

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Internships through CareerTrackers and CareerSeekers and our partnership with Google, recognising Google Career Certificates, are helping us attract new people. Our graduate strategy supports our future workforce and helps address talent scarcity.

column13: We published our third Modern Slavery Statement in December 2022 and launched Modern Slavery training modules to support its application across the business. Management of ESG issues is governed by a Board-approved Social and Environmental Framework, which was updated this year to strengthen ESG governance.

column8: Aboriginal and Torres Strait IslanderÃÂ employment
column13: We engaged two First Nations recruitment partners, IPA and Pipeline Talent, to progress towards our target. We partner with CareerTrackers in Australia, First Foundation, and TupuToa in New Zealand to provide internships to high school and university students.
column21: First Nations Recruitment, Internship Partnerships, University students

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column7: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders were 1.19% of our employees (or 101 employees) at the end of FY23. The extension of our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employment target of 3% of our Australian employees from FY23 until FY25 aligns with the release of our Reconciliation Action Plan.

column7: In this Reporting Period, 19 contracts in Australia and 18 in New Zealand were uplifted to include clauses relating to modern slavery.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: We have also focused on improving supply chain performance in our property repairs. We have extended our contracts and long-term relationships with suppliers to provide us and our builders with better cost certainty. We are focused on reducing and closing outstanding claims as quickly as possible.
column21: Supply Chain Performance, Property Repairs, Compliance

column6: Political contributions
column13: Our approach at IAG is to assess suppliers' compliance with this Code on an ongoing basis to drive continuous improvement for IAG and people and communities along our supply chain. IAG will consider a supplier's performance by this Code when making sourcing decisions and managing our relationships with suppliers.
column21: Supplier Compliance, Code Assessment, Continuous improvement
